meanings.definition: A person who spoils the enjoyment of others.
meanings.sent1: My sister is such a killjoy when she refuses to play games with us.
meanings.sent2: The killjoy at the party kept complaining about the music being too loud.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy neighbor acted like a killjoy by turning off the sprinklers during our water fight.
meanings.sent4: The rain clouds were like a killjoy, blocking the view of the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher was a real killjoy, always stopping us from having fun in class.

meanings.definition: To spoil the enjoyment or pleasure of others.
meanings.sent1: Please don't killjoy our plans by canceling at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: His negative comments always seem to killjoy the mood of the group.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather threatened to killjoy our picnic, but we had fun indoors instead.
meanings.sent4: Her constant complaints about the movie were like a dark cloud trying to killjoy our movie night.
meanings.sent5: I didn't want to killjoy their excitement, so I pretended to enjoy the activity with them.
